english_translation: Narrated by a man from Bani Sulaim: I proposed marriage to Umamah bint Abd al-Muttalib to the Prophet ﷺ, and he gave her to me in marriage without him witnessing (the marriage sermon/testimony). (Abu Bakr [the compiler] said: It has also been narrated from a man from Bani Shaiban that I proposed marriage to Umamah...)

narrators.name: Bundar
narrators.full_name: Amr ibn Hamad ibn Talhah al-Qannadi

narrators.name: Shu'bah
narrators.full_name: Shu'bah ibn al-Hajjaj ibn al-Ward al-Ataki

narrators.name: An unnamed man from Bani Sulaim

Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Multiple unnamed men (رجل) from Bani Sulaim - these are Majhul al-Ayn (completely unknown narrators)
Bundar has theological sect affiliation (Shi'a) though he is still Thiqah
Multiple indirect transmission terms ('an) combined with unknown narrators
The chain goes from Shu'bah to al-Ala', then to an unnamed man, then to Ismail, then to another unnamed man

potential_issues.issue: The chain contains multiple unnamed men (رجل) from Bani Sulaim - these are Majhul al-Ayn (completely unknown narrators)
potential_issues.impact: Unknown narrators are a critical flaw that severely weakens the chain

potential_issues.issue: Bundar has Shi'a theological sect affiliation, though he is graded Thiqah
potential_issues.impact: This is informational and does not directly affect hadith transmission reliability

Topics: Marriage proposal to Umamah bint Abd al-Muttalib
Marriage without formal sermon or testimony (غير أن يتشهد)

english_translation: Narrated by the Sulami: The Prophet ﷺ made a knot in my hand and said: Tasbeeh (glorification) is half of the balance, and Praise be to Allah fills it, and Takbeer (magnification) fills what is between the heavens and the earth, and fasting is half of patience, and ablution is half of faith.

narrators.name: Sulayman ibn Abd al-Jabbar
narrators.full_name: Khawat ibn Salih ibn Khawat ibn Jubayr

narrators.name: Fitr
narrators.full_name: Uqar ibn al-Mughirah ibn Shu'bah al-Thaqafi

narrators.name: Abu Ishaq
narrators.full_name: Ubaidullah ibn Abbas ibn Abd al-Muttalib

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: The companion at the end is referred to only as 'The Sulami' (al-Sulami) without a specific name - this is a Majhul (unknown) narrator
Multiple Saduq-graded narrators (Ali ibn Asim, Fitr, Abu Ishaq, al-Harith)
Use of indirect transmission term ('an) in several places

potential_issues.issue: The companion is referred to only as 'The Sulami' without a specific name - Majhul (unknown narrator)
potential_issues.impact: Unknown companion is a critical flaw that severely weakens this hadith

potential_issues.issue: Multiple Saduq-graded narrators in the chain
potential_issues.impact: Reduces the overall reliability of the chain

Topics: Virtues of tasbeeh (glorification of Allah) and takbeer (magnification)
Praise of Allah filling the balance scale

english_translation: Narrated by a man from Bani Sulaim from his grandfather: He came to the Prophet ﷺ with silver, so the Prophet ﷺ said: What is this? He said: This is from a mine. The Prophet ﷺ said: There will be mines and the worst of people will attend them.

narrators.name: Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaybah
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Shaybah

narrators.name: An unnamed man from Bani Sulaim
Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: The chain contains multiple unnamed narrators - an unnamed man from Bani Sulaim and his unnamed grandfather (the companion)
These are Majhul (unknown narrators) which is a critical flaw
Multiple indirect transmission terms ('an)

potential_issues.issue: The chain contains completely unnamed narrators - an unidentified man from Bani Sulaim and his grandfather (presumably a companion)
potential_issues.impact: Unknown narrators are a critical flaw that makes this hadith weak

Topics: Prophecy about mines of silver and gold
Warning that the worst of people will be drawn to mineral wealth

english_translation: And from Qais are the sons of Muawiyah ibn Bakr, and Sa'd ibn Bakr, and Manbah ibn Bakr ibn Hawzan.

chainIssues: This entry contains only tribal references

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok

english_translation: Atiyyah al-Sa'di ibn Sa'd ibn Bakr ibn Hawazin ibn Mansur.

chainIssues: This entry contains only a person's name

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok

english_translation: Narrated by Atiyyah al-Sa'di from his grandfather: The Prophet ﷺ said: Anger is from Satan, and Satan was created from fire, and water extinguishes fire. So when any one of you becomes angry, let him perform ablution.

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

english_translation: The Prophet ﷺ said: When the ruler rages, Satan takes control. (Second chain) Narrated by Atiyyah al-Sa'di and he was a companion.

english_translation: Narrated by Suhayl ibn Abdullah: The Prophet ﷺ said: When a man divorces his wife, then marries another woman, and then divorces her too, is he [still] the first wife's husband?

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Good chain with reliable narrators and strong transmission term (سَمِعْتُ)

english_translation: Narrated by Uqbah ibn Amir al-Juhani: The Prophet ﷺ said: None of you believes until his love for his brother is like his love for himself.
